wikipedia_page.main: The Hon. George Ponsonby (1773 – 5 June 1863), was an Irish politician, who served as a Junior Lord of the Treasury in the governments under Earl Grey (his brother-in-law) and Lord Melbourne from 1832 to 1834.

response: # Edward Granville George Howard, 1st Baron Lanerton (1809–1880), who married Diana Ponsonby, daughter of the Hon. George Ponsonby.
George Ponsonby (5 March 17558 July 1817), was a British lawyer and Whig politician. He served as Lord Chancellor of Ireland from 1806 to 1807 in the Ministry of All the Talents.
# George Ponsonby was a Member of Parliament and Junior Lord of the Treasury.
*George Ponsonby (Junior Lord of the Treasury) (1773–1863), Irish politician
*1806 17 November, George Ponsonby (to 1812), b. 1773, d. 5 June 1863 aged 90

On 6 August 1803, Boyle was commissioned captain of a sixth unit, that of Youghal. During the 1st and 2nd Parliaments Boyle was not listed as either a Tory or a Whig. However he ran as a Whig in the 1806 United Kingdom general election. He was elected alongside George Ponsonby, a fellow Whig. Their faction was at the time under the leadership of Charles Grey, 2nd Earl Grey.

response: Spencer retired to Woolbeding which he had tastefully embellished. He died on 23 June 1831, “a venerable grave old man”. He left Wooldeding to his natural daughter Diana Bouverie whose mother had predeceased him. She married George Ponsonby.
